definition: pad/cushion/mat/to pad out/to fill a gap/to pay for sb/to advance (money)
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
stepping stone/fig. person used to advance one's career

sentences.english: China, she says, will use it as a stepping stone toward political integration.
sentences.chinese: 她說，大陸將會利用經濟協議作爲政治統合的墊腳石。

sentences.english: See failure as a stepping stone to success.
sentences.chinese: 把失敗當做通往成功的墊腳石。

sentences.english: Perot is only a stepping stone to the transformation Dell needs to make.
sentences.chinese: 對於戴爾需要進行的轉型來說，佩羅只是一塊墊腳石。

sentences.english: Your short-term goals can become stepping stones to reaching long-term goals.
sentences.chinese: 短期計劃是你實現長期目標的墊腳石。

sentences.english: The next rock in your path may be a stepping stone.
sentences.chinese: 也許人生路上的下一個絆腳石就是墊腳石。

sentences.english: Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.
sentences.chinese: 氣餒和失敗絕對是成功的墊腳石。

sentences.english: The key to success is to turn blocking stone into stepping-stone.
sentences.chinese: 人生的一大祕訣就是將絆腳石變成墊腳石。

sentences.english: This should merely serve as a stepping stone for you to discover what works for you.
sentences.chinese: 這點僅會作爲一個墊腳石，幫助你找到自己的方法。

sentences.english: With innovative juts on the inner bottom designed specially for easy piling and extraction.
sentences.chinese: 獨特的籃內墊腳設計，方便疊置，容易取出。

sentences.english: Failures are the stepping stones to success.
And I take every snag in my way as a stepping-stone.
sentences.chinese: 我會把每個障礙當作是墊腳石。

sentences.english: Parallels with mounting keys will be doweled with a minimum .
sentences.chinese: 帶有安裝健的墊腳應用銷釘固定，銷釘最小直徑爲。

definition: toe box (of a shoe)/shoe last (shoemaker's tool)
